- Topic: Zoning Ordinance Amendment for Shooting Range
- Summary: The ordinance aims to create a definition and use standards for "shooting range", add it to use tables in appropriate districts, and establish site design standards. It was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33368 - 28736 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)

- Topic: Zoning Ordinance Amendment for Dormitory
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to classify "dormitory" as a permitted use in the CBD-1 Core Central Business District. It was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33369 - 28737 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)

- Topic: Zoning Ordinance Amendment for Telecommunications Tower
- Summary: This ordinance grants an amendment to permit the extension of a wireless telecommunications tower from 63.5 feet to 73.5 feet in specified districts. It was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33370 - 28738 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)

- UID: a9459542-5c1b-452e-a45e-d009bea0dba4

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance
- Summary: The ordinance aims to align Inclusionary Zoning requirements with previously adopted legislation and provide parking reduction standards, amended or new definitions, and alignment of zoning use tables. The proposal applies to properties within designated zoning districts and voluntary provisions.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,371
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Inclusionary Zoning, City Planning
- UID: aef6dde4-ac75-460e-81db-53b6ab23f587

- Topic: Minimum Wage Establishment
- Summary: This ordinance requires the evaluation and recommendation of establishing a minimum wage of $15 per hour by the Department of City Civil Service, in accordance with the Home Rule Charter.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,388
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Majority)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted following approval by the Budget Committee.
- Tags/Keywords: Minimum Wage, Civil Service, Budget Committee
- UID: aef6dde4-ac75-460e-81db-53b6ab23f587

- Topic: Campaign Contribution Restrictions
- Summary: The resolution prohibits council members from accepting campaign contributions from specific entities related to utility regulation and RFQ/RFP processes.
- Ordinance Number: R-21-268
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Campaign Contributions, Utility Regulation, RFQ, RFP
- UID: aef6dde4-ac75-460e-81db-53b6ab23f587
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-15-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Granting non-exclusive franchise to McLeodUSA Telecommunications Services, LLC
- Summary: The ordinance grants a non-exclusive franchise to McLeodUSA Telecommunications Services, LLC to construct, maintain, and operate a fiber-optic based communications system. It also provides for surety bond and annual payments.
- Ordinance Number: 32930
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was passed, and the non-exclusive franchise was granted to McLeodUSA Telecommunications Services, LLC.
- Tags/Keywords: Franchise, Telecommunications, Fiber-optic, Communication System
- UID: 1e88b973-78d8-4f8d-8200-b9c96e823014

- Topic: Amendment of Section 26-15 of the City Code
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend and reordain Section 26-15 of the City Code regarding peer review of structural design and inspection by engineers of record during construction, specifying where such reviews and inspections are required, how and by whom they are to be performed.
- Ordinance Number: 33147
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The outcome of the vote was not specified in the provided information.
- Tags/Keywords: City Code Amendment, Peer Review, Structural Design, Inspection
- UID: 1e88b973-78d8-4f8d-8200-b9c96e823014
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-15-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Pardon Power and Marijuana Possession
- Summary: Councilmember Moreno proposed an ordinance to clarify the pardon power of the Mayor and City Council, specifically to authorize the prospective pardon of marijuana possession. The ordinance was referred to the Criminal Justice Committee, which recommended approval, and it was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33147
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Referred to Committee)
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Criminal Justice Committee for review and approval recommendation.
- Tags/Keywords: Pardon power, marijuana possession, Criminal Justice Committee
- UID: 75541467-feef-4cc1-82e8-af31c4365241

- Topic: Enforcement of Smoke Free Air Act and Marijuana Smoking Prohibition
- Summary: Councilmember Moreno presented an ordinance to amend sections of the City's Smoke Free Air Act, explicitly authorizing NOPD to enforce the Act only via summons and prohibiting the smoking of marijuana outside of a private residence. The ordinance was referred to the Criminal Justice Committee, which recommended approval, but a technical correction was needed. It was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33328
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Referred to Committee)
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Criminal Justice Committee for review and pending technical correction.
- Tags/Keywords: Smoke Free Air Act, marijuana smoking prohibition, NOPD, Criminal Justice Committee
- UID: 75541467-feef-4cc1-82e8-af31c4365241

- Topic: Amendments to Marijuana Regulations and Police Discretion
- Summary: Councilmember Moreno introduced an ordinance to amend sections of the City's Code related to marijuana, excluding marijuana testing from certain drug testing programs, excluding marijuana accessories from the definition of drug paraphernalia, and clarifying that policy officers have discretion not to issue summons for marijuana possession in certain circumstances. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 8/5/21.
- Ordinance Number: 33329
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A - (Referred to Committee)
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the next meeting for further discussion and consideration.
- Tags/Keywords: Marijuana regulations, drug testing, police discretion
- UID: 75541467-feef-4cc1-82e8-af31c4365241
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-15-2021

messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-15-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Granting of servitude for encroachments on public right-of-way
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into an agreement to grant a servitude to adjacent property owners for encroachments on portions of public right-of-way located at 827 Canal Street and 365 Canal Street. The purpose is to fix the minimum price and terms of the servitude agreements and ensure that the use granted does not interfere with the public right-of-way.
- Ordinance Number: 33,363 and 33,364
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: Passed - (Details not available)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinances were both adopted, allowing the Mayor to enter into servitude agreements for the specified properties.
- Tags/Keywords: Servitude, Public Right-of-Way, Encroachments, Canal Street
- UID: 07d7b7b2-771b-42a8-aa1a-81e0806dc839
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-15-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Authorization of Lease Agreement for 800 France Street
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a lease agreement for encroachments on public right-of-way at 800 France Street. The minimum price and terms of the lease agreement are fixed, and it is stated that the use granted in the lease agreement will not interfere with the public right-of-way. The ordinance passed.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,365
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Authorization of the lease agreement

- UID: 91eca208-8925-4acf-af6f-512b97347e59

- Topic: Authorization of Servitude Agreement for 501 Decatur Street
- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor to enter into a servitude agreement for encroachments on public right-of-way at 501 Decatur Street. The minimum price and terms of the servitude agreement are fixed, and it is stated that the use granted in the servitude agreement will not interfere with the public right-of-way. The ordinance passed.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,366
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Authorization of the servitude agreement
- Tags/Keywords: Servitude Agreement, Public Right-of-way, Mayor, Authorization
- UID: 91eca208-8925-4acf-af6f-512b97347e59

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Resolution R-21-273
- Summary: The resolution supports a retrofit of the City's current jail, specifically the Option 3 retrofit plans in the July 23, 2020 JFA Institute report, over a new Phase III building. The retrofit is favored for its benefits in cost, timeline, and aspirational quality care standards for the acute and sub-acute mentally ill population.
- Ordinance Number: R-21-273
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Adopted - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution was adopted to support the retrofit of the City's current jail.
- Tags/Keywords: Resolution, Retrofit, Jail, Mental Health, Cost, Quality Care
- UID: cf6a4dc8-9829-420d-92ff-3ddd66535f61

- Topic: Resolution R-21-274
- Summary: This resolution supports a retrofit of the City's current jail, specifically the Option 3 retrofit plans in the July 23, 2020 JFA Institute report, over a new Phase III building. The retrofit is favored for its benefits in cost, timeline, and aspirational quality care standards for the acute and sub-acute mentally ill population.
- Ordinance Number: R-21-274
- Votes Summary: (Voting details not provided in the available summary)
- Decision/Key Actions: The resolution supports a retrofit of the City's current jail, specifically the Option 3 retrofit plans in the July 23, 2020 JFA Institute report, over a new Phase III building.
- Tags/Keywords: Resolution, Retrofit, Jail, Mental Health, Cost, Quality Care
- UID: cf6a4dc8-9829-420d-92ff-3ddd66535f61
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 7-15-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Directing City Planning Commission to conduct a public hearing for amendments to permit a prison and related uses for the housing of inmates with mental health conditions
- Summary: The ordinance aims to consider amendments to permit a prison and related uses for the housing of male and female inmates classified with acute and sub-acute mental health conditions. The City Planning Commission will conduct a public hearing to consider the adaptive reuse of the Orleans Parish Justice Center's Phase 2 building or other existing resources for this purpose.
- Ordinance Number: R-21-274
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to direct the City Planning Commission was adopted unanimously with 7 YEAS and no NAYS.
- Tags/Keywords: City Planning Commission, mental health inmates, public hearing, adaptive reuse
- UID: 6c4186bf-5ecf-452b-b932-1d5775d7fedf
